title.text: Empiricist Solutions to Nativist Puzzles by means of Unsupervised TSG

abstractContent.text: While the debate between nativism and em-piricism exists since several decades, surprisingly few common learning problems have been proposed for assessing the two opposing views.
Most empiricist researchers have focused on a relatively small number of linguistic problems, such as Auxiliary Front-ing or Anaphoric One.

In the current paper we extend the number of common test cases to a much larger series of problems related to wh-questions, relative clause formation, topicalization, extraposition from NP and left dislocation.
We show that these hard cases can be empirically solved by an unsu-pervised tree-substitution grammar inferred from child-directed input in the Adam corpus (Childes database).
